STEP 2 - EVIDENCE-BASED TREATMENT SELECTION: Now I'll select treatments based on current clinical guidelines. - First-line treatment per guidelines: Supportive care with cold compresses, artificial tears, and topical antihistamines if allergic; topical antibiotics if bacterial superinfection is suspected. - Supporting evidence: Most cases of viral or allergic conjunctivitis are self-limited; symptomatic relief improves comfort, and antibiotics are used only if bacterial infection is confirmed. - Patient-specific considerations: Recent trauma necessitates ruling out abrasions, avoiding topical corticosteroids initially unless prescribed by specialist. - Contraindications or cautions: Avoid unnecessary antibiotics or steroids without confirmed bacterial infection; monitor for signs of worsening.
